items.title: Gaza 'humanitarian zone' struck almost 100 times since May, BBC Verify finds
items.description: The area in Gaza which Israel's military has told people to go to "for their safety" has been hit by 97 strikes since May, BBC Verify analysis has rev...

items.title: LA faces 'extreme fire danger' as high winds forecast
items.description: Gusts are expected to kick up again early on Wednesday - as a 25th death is confirmed in the US disaster.

items.title: Mozambique's new president sworn in despite opposition boycott
items.description: Daniel Chapo's legitimacy has been questioned following protests against his victory.

items.title: What happens if TikTok is banned by the US?
items.description: Could there be ways to bypass the ban - and could president-elect Donald Trump find a way to stop the law?

items.title: Why has it been so hard to arrest S Korea's impeached president?
items.description: Investigators had to scale ladders and cut through barbed wire to reach President Yoon's residence.
